xml.brief: Get information on available logging features

desc.p: This method tells which features are available for logging a cache or editing a log. You may use it to dynamically disable or hide nonfunctional options in a user interface.

Using this method is always optional. You never need to know about differences between OKAPI installations or logging preconditions. If a logging feature is not avaible, OKAPI will return a user-friendly explanation.

req.name: reference_item

ul.li: The code of the geocache to be logged. Available features for services/logs/submit will be returned.
The UUID of the log entry to be edited. Available features for services/logs/edit will be returned.

req.p: The returned values depend on the type and state of the geocache, on previous logs and on the OC site. They can change any time.

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

li.p: log_types - a list of the log types your user can currently submit for the geocache. Available types depend on many parameters, like the cache type and state.

can_rate - boolean, true if the user can rate the geocache; false if a submitted rating will be ignored. Ratings may be disabled for some cache types or for caches that the user already rated or owns. Some OC installations do not provide ratings.
can_recommend - tells if the user can rate the geocache; one of the following:

ul.li: true if the user can add a recommendation for the geocache,
need_more_finds if the user needs to find more caches to add a recommendation for the geocache. A submitted recommendation will be ignored,
false if the user cannot recommend the cache for some other reason, e.g. the user owns or already recommended the cache. A submitted recommendation will be ignored.

li.p: can_set_needs_maintenance - boolean, true if the user can set a "needs maintenance" state of the cache by submitting needs_maintenance2=true; false if this argument will be ignored. This feature is not available for all cache types.

can_reset_needs_maintenance - boolean, true if the user can reset a "needs maintenance" state of the cache by submitting needs_maintenance2=false; false if this argument will be ignored. This feature is not available yet at some OC installations.
